main_definition: Partnerships refer to a mutually beneficial relationship or collaboration between two or more parties who share resources, responsibilities, risks, and rewards towards achieving common goals.

meanings_and_examples.example: When a software company collaborates with another firm to develop new technologies, it's referred to as a business partnership.
A husband and wife working together in running their household is an example of marital partnership.
When two or more organizations collaborate to promote environmental protection, it's termed as an environmental conservation partnership.
A school partnering with a local college for internship programs is an example of educational partnership.
When different political parties come together to form a government, it's known as a political alliance or coalition, which can be seen as a type of partnership.
